div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 120px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 32px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 610px; margin-left: 110px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 32px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 180px; margin-left: 12px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: Set 12 different chips (instances/clients). (1 board represent 1 team

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: For each client, it has to control 12 pins. (for each pin, you have to set the voltage to 0v or 3.3v.

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: You would have a central server, it controls the 12 clients.

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: For each client, it also has another 12 buttons, it receives the input from our users and the central server needed to get that info

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: We have to have a central server, it should be written by using Python, and it has to connect to 12 clients. The server needed to distiguash the 12 different clients. And receive differetent boards informatin accordingly

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: We have to maintain a shared state for all those pins for each client

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 415px; margin-left: 12px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li:
Machine type selection will only changes the background image
；

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: For each client; it shoud display 12 buttons; red button means off, green button means on.

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: Different client/team(board) could return different button press signal to indicate the fixing

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: Turing. If they choose red pin, turn red to green, meaning they made a right fixing

li.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ol.li: Statistic for scores (by displaying a ‘start test’ button

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 765px; margin-left: 12px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: For the Server, it meantains this:

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: Since the client chip will only send back the button press signal, so it is OK to think that any 'to' == -1 is the button status.

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: What I mean is if the data is send from client to server, then the 'data' represent the button pressing.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1365px; margin-left: 12px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 2px ; font-stretch: normal ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"
p.b: For the client, it listens to those button-clicks

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: For each time, it will receive a number, from 1 to 12

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: It should also have a constant number to indicate who it is, it is a number between 1-12.

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: For the client, it should also meantain a dict:

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue" ; min-height: 15px
margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 13px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

switch.text: For the client, it listens to those button-clicks...

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
